node.title: U.S. Detects First Case of Omicron Variant That May Evade Vaccines in California
node.alt: Omicron, a COVID-19 variant that could evade vaccines and treatments, has been detected in the United States. People shop at the Polaris Fashion Place mall during Black Friday on November 26 in Columbus, Ohio.
node.description: Omicron may also be more transmissible than other coronavirus variants, and health officials warn that the world needs to take it seriously.
node.content:
["The new coronavirus variant of concern, Omicron, has been detected in the United States just about a week after it was discovered in South Africa.", "The United States detected its first case on Wednesday in California, according to the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). Omicron became a variant of concern last Friday because it has attributes that could make it more transmissible, and experts are worried it could evade vaccines.", "The California and San Francisco departments of public health informed the CDC that a recent case of COVID-19 in an individual in California was caused by the Omicron variant. The person returned from South Africa on November 22 and was fully vaccinated.", "Ahead of the virus being detected in the United States, President Joe Biden instituted a travel ban on people coming from South Africa. The ban on travel from that country, Botswana, Zimbabwe, Namibia, Lesotho, Eswatini, Mozambique and Malawi began on November 29, but health experts warned it may have come too late.", "As has been seen with previous travel bans, excluding travel from one area doesn't guarantee a variant won't appear in the United States. Early on during the pandemic, former President Donald Trump banned travel from China to try to prevent coronavirus cases in the United States, but a surge in New York turned out to be fueled by travelers from Europe.", "", "
Omicron, a COVID-19 variant that could evade vaccines and treatments, has been detected in the United States. People shop at the Polaris Fashion Place mall during Black Friday on November 26 in Columbus, Ohio.
", "Several European countries have already detected Omicron, and Dr. Anthony Fauci, director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, said he wouldn't be \"surprised\" if the variant was already in the United States.", "\"We have not detected it yet, but when you have a virus that is showing this degree of transmissibility and you're already having travel-related cases that they've been noted in Israel and Belgium and in other places\u2014when you have a virus like this, it almost invariably, is ultimately going to go essentially all over,\" Fauci told Weekend Today on November 27.", "When Omicron was first detected, experts noticed it had a \"large number of mutations\" that had the potential to make it more contagious than other variants and possibly evade treatments and vaccines. It could be weeks before data proves this, but Fauci said it's necessary to \"assume that's the case,\" noting that the suggestion is \"enough\" to make people pay \"really close attention\" and prepare for the seriousness of the variant.", "Fauci reportedly recommended instituting the travel ban, according to Politico, but he told Weekend Today that it wouldn't stop the variant from spreading. The goal, he said, was to give the United States more time to better assess the situation and respond accordingly.", "In light of the new variant's potential to evade vaccines, Moderna and Pfizer have begun working on a vaccine that specifically targets the Omicron variant. However, Moderna said it could be months before a new version starts shipping out. It's possible the company will decide to give people a higher dosage of the current vaccine to better protect against Omicron in the meantime, and high-risk populations could need a fourth dose."]
